document.heading: District of Columbia Solid Waste Management and Multi-Material Recycling Act of 1988 Amendment Temporary Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-93, the “District of Columbia Solid Waste Management and Multi-Material Recycling Act of 1988 Amendment Temporary Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-484. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 5, 1989, and December 19, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 11, 1990, it was assigned Act No. 8-144 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. Law 8-93 became effective on March 15, 1990.

meta.search-text: kwiktag ® 103 203 354 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 8-93 "District of Columbia Solid Waste Management and Multi-Material Recycling Act of 1988 Amend- ment Temporary Act of 1989 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 8-484 on first and second readings, December 5, 1989, and December 19, 1989, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on January II, 1990, this legislation was assigned Act No. 8-144, published in the January 26, 1990, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 37 page 780) and transmitted to Congress on January 23, 1990 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(i) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 8-93, effective March 15, 1990 aV irman o the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: January 23,24,25,26,29,30,31 February 1,2,5,6,7,8,20,21,22,23,26,27,28 March 1,2,5,6,7,8,9,12,13,14 D.C.LAW 8 -gs MAI 5 1990 Enrolled Original Codification District of Columbia Code (1990 Supplement) AN ACT D.C, 8 144 IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA JAN 1 tq.qn To amend, on an temporary basis, the District of Columbia Solid Waste Management and Multi-Material Recycling Act of 1988 to clarify that owners and occupants of commercial property are responsible for recycling, and to require the Director of the Department of Public ~rks to enter into contracts or agreements to market recyclable materials. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Solid Waste Management and Multi-Material Recycling Act of 1988 Amendment Temporary Act of 1989 Sec. 2. The District of Columbia Solid Waste Management and Multi-Material Recycling Act of 1988, effective March 16, 1989 (D.C. Law 7-226; D.C. Code, sec. 6-3401 et seq Recycling Act is amended as follows a) Section 4(19 D.C. Code, sec. 6-3403(19 is amended by adding the phrase "majority of owners or" after the phrase "if the b) Sections 8(a) and (b D.C. Code, sec. 6-3407 (a) and (b are amended by adding the phrase "owners and" before the word "occupants" wherever it appears; and (c) Section 12 (D.C. Code, sec. 6-3411) is amended by adding a new sentence to the end to read as follows The Director of the Department of Public Works shall enter into contracts or agreements to market recyclable materials, including the sale or disposition of recyclable materials, and shall purchase or lease any equipment necessary to facilitate the marketing of recyclable materials Sec. 3 a) This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as Section 6-3403 Section 6-3407 Section 6-3411 1 provided in section 602(c)(i) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C.
